    PrivateKey: require("./ecc/src/PrivateKey"),
    PublicKey: require("./ecc/src/PublicKey"),

    key: require("./ecc/src/KeyUtils"),

name: lib/chain/index.js
lib/chain/src/AccountLogin.js
lib/chain/src/ChainStore.js

unknown.tagValue:
maintains a local cache of blockchain state

 The ChainStore maintains a local cache of blockchain state and exposes
 an API that makes it easy to query objects and receive updates when
 objects are available.

name: subscribers
description: tracks everyone who wants to receive updates when the cache changes

name: clearCache
description:
Clears all cached state.  This should be called any time the network connection is
reset.

name: subscribe
description: Add a callback that will be called anytime any object in the cache is updated

name: unsubscribe
description: Remove a callback that was previously added via subscribe

name: clearObjectCache
description:
Clear an object from the cache to force it to be fetched again. This may
be useful if a query failed the first time and the wallet has reason to believe
it may succeede the second time.

name: getObject
description:
There are three states an object id could be in:

1. undefined       - returned if a query is pending
3. defined         - return an object
4. null            - query return null

return.description: object if the id_or_symbol exists

params.name: the
params.description: public key to find accounts that reference it

return.description:
undefined if the result is unknown

 If this method returns undefined, then it will send a request to
 the server for the current set of accounts after which the
 server will notify us of any accounts that reference these keys

params.name: the
params.description: account id to find accounts that reference it

return.description:
undefined if the result is unknown

 If this method returns undefined, then it will send a request to
 the server for the current set of accounts after which the
 server will notify us of any accounts that reference these keys

a empty Set if no items are found

If this method returns undefined, then it will send a request to the server for
the current state after which it will be subscribed to changes to this set.

name: fetchObject
description:
If there is not already a pending request to fetch this object, a new
 request will be made.

return.description: the object if it does exist and is in our cache
the account object if it does exist
the account name

name: getWitnessById
description:
This method will attempt to lookup witness by account_id.
If witness doesn't exist it will return null, if witness is found it will return witness object,
if it's not fetched yet it will return undefined.

name: getCommitteeMemberById
description:
This method will attempt to lookup committee member by account_id.
If committee member doesn't exist it will return null, if committee member is found it will return committee member object,
if it's not fetched yet it will return undefined.

return.description: a promise with the workers array
a promise with the witness object
a promise with the witness object

name: fetchFullAccount
description: Fetches an account and all of its associated data in a single query

return.description: null if the object has been queried and was not found

name: fetchRecentHistory
description:
There are two ways to extend the account history, add new more
recent history, and extend historic hstory. This method will fetch
the most recent account history and prepend it to the list of
historic operations.

return.description: a promise with the account history

name: _updateObject
description:
Updates the object in place by only merging the set
 properties of object.

 This method will create an immutable object with the given ID if
 it does not already exist.

 This is a "private" method called when data is received from the
 server and should not be used by others.

unknown.tagValue: object.id must be a valid object ID

return.description: an Immutable constructed from object and deep merged with the current state

name: lib/chain/src/ChainTypes.js
content:
let ChainTypes = {};

ChainTypes.reserved_spaces = {
    relative_protocol_ids: 0,
    protocol_ids: 1,
    implementation_ids: 2
};

ChainTypes.object_type = {
    null: 0,
    base: 1,
    account: 2,
    asset: 3,
    force_settlement: 4,
    committee_member: 5,
    witness: 6,
    limit_order: 7,
    call_order: 8,
    custom: 9,
    proposal: 10,
    operation_history: 11,
    withdraw_permission: 12,
    vesting_balance: 13,
    worker: 14,
    balance: 15
};

ChainTypes.impl_object_type = {
    global_property: 0,
    dynamic_global_property: 1,
    index_meta: 2,
    asset_dynamic_data: 3,
    asset_bitasset_data: 4,
    account_balance: 5,
    account_statistics: 6,
    transaction: 7,
    block_summary: 8,
    account_transaction_history: 9,
    blinded_balance: 10,
    chain_property: 11,
    witness_schedule: 12,
    budget_record: 13
};

ChainTypes.vote_type = {
    committee: 0,
    witness: 1,
    worker: 2
};

ChainTypes.operations = {
    transfer: 0,
    limit_order_create: 1,
    limit_order_cancel: 2,
    call_order_update: 3,
    fill_order: 4,
    account_create: 5,
    account_update: 6,
    account_whitelist: 7,
    account_upgrade: 8,
    account_transfer: 9,
    asset_create: 10,
    asset_update: 11,
    asset_update_bitasset: 12,
    asset_update_feed_producers: 13,
    asset_issue: 14,
    asset_reserve: 15,
    asset_fund_fee_pool: 16,
    asset_settle: 17,
    asset_global_settle: 18,
    asset_publish_feed: 19,
    witness_create: 20,
    witness_update: 21,
    proposal_create: 22,
    proposal_update: 23,
    proposal_delete: 24,
    withdraw_permission_create: 25,
    withdraw_permission_update: 26,
    withdraw_permission_claim: 27,
    withdraw_permission_delete: 28,
    committee_member_create: 29,
    committee_member_update: 30,
    committee_member_update_global_parameters: 31,
    vesting_balance_create: 32,
    vesting_balance_withdraw: 33,
    worker_create: 34,
    custom: 35,
    assert: 36,
    balance_claim: 37,
    override_transfer: 38,
    transfer_to_blind: 39,
    blind_transfer: 40,
    transfer_from_blind: 41,
    asset_settle_cancel: 42,
    asset_claim_fees: 43
};

export default ChainTypes;

id_regex
description:
Account names may contain one or more names separated by a dot.
Each name needs to start with a letter and may contain
numbers, or well placed dashes.

NumberUtils
description: Convert 12.34 with a precision of 3 into 12340

unknown.tagValue: {number|string} number - Use strings for large numbers.  This may contain one decimal but no sign
{number} precision - number of implied decimal places (usually causes right zero padding)

name: lib/chain/src/ObjectId.js
lib/chain/src/TransactionBuilder.js

unknown.tagValue: {object} operation - JSON matchching the operation's format

name: process_transaction
description: This does it all: set fees, finalize, sign, and broadcast (if wanted).

unknown.tagValue: {ConfidentialWallet} cwallet - must be unlocked, used to gather signing keys

{array<string>} [signer_pubkeys = null] - Optional ["GPHAbc9Def0...", ...].  These are additional signing keys.  Some balance claims require propritary address formats, the witness node can't tell us which ones are needed so they must be passed in.  If the witness node can figure out a signing key (mostly all other transactions), it should not be passed in here.

name: finalize
description: Typically this is called automatically just prior to signing.  Once finalized this transaction can not be changed.

return.description: hex transaction ID

name: add_operation
description: Typically one will use {@link this.add_type_operation} instead.

name: set_expire_seconds
description: optional: there is a deafult expiration

name: set_required_fees
description: optional: the fees can be obtained from the witness node

toBlockchainAddress
description: bts::blockchain::address (unique but not a full public key)

name: toString
description: Alias for {@link toPublicKeyString}

name: toPublicKeyString
description:
Full public key
{return} string

return.description: PublicKey or `null` (if the public_key string is invalid)
PublicKey

name: lib/ecc/src/address.js
Address
description: Addresses are shortened non-reversable hashes of a public key.  The full PublicKey is preferred.

return.description: Address - Compressed PTS format (by default)

name: lib/ecc/src/aes.js
Aes
description: Provides symetric encrypt and decrypt via AES.

name: clear
description: This is an excellent way to ensure that all references to Aes can not operate anymore (example: a wallet becomes locked).  An application should ensure there is only one Aes object instance for a given secret `seed`.

unknown.tagValue: {string} seed - secret seed may be used to encrypt or decrypt.
{string} hash - A 128 byte hex string, typically one would call {@link fromSeed} instead.
{PrivateKey} private_key - required and used for decryption
{PublicKey} public_key - required and used to calcualte the shared secret
{string} [nonce = ""] optional but should always be provided and be unique when re-using the same private/public keys more than once.  This nonce is not a secret.
{string|Buffer} message - Encrypted message containing a checksum

name: encrypt_with_checksum
description: Identical to {@link decrypt_with_checksum} but used to encrypt.  Should not throw an error.

return.description: message - Encrypted message which includes a checksum

name: decrypt
description: This method does not use a checksum, the returned data must be validated some other way.

return.description: binary

name: encrypt
description: This method does not use a checksum, the returned data must be validated some other way.

return.description: binary

name: encryptToHex
description: This method does not use a checksum, the returned data must be validated some other way.

return.description: hex

name: decryptHex
description: This method does not use a checksum, the returned data must be validated some other way.

return.description: binary (could easily be readable text)

name: decryptHexToBuffer
description: This method does not use a checksum, the returned data must be validated some other way.

return.description: encoded as specified by the parameter

name: decryptHexToText
description: This method does not use a checksum, the returned data must be validated some other way.

return.description: encoded as specified by the parameter

name: encryptHex
description: This method does not use a checksum, the returned data must be validated some other way.

return.description: hex

name: lib/ecc/src/ecdsa.js
calcPubKeyRecoveryParam
description:
Calculate pubkey extraction parameter.

When extracting a pubkey from a signature, we have to
distinguish four different cases. Rather than putting this
burden on the verifier, Bitcoin includes a 2-bit value with the
signature.

This function simply tries all four cases and returns the value
that resulted in a successful pubkey recovery.

name: recoverPubKey
description:
Recover a public key from a signature.

See SEC 1: Elliptic Curve Cryptography, section 4.1.6, "Public
Key Recovery Operation".

http://www.secg.org/download/aid-780/sec1-v2.pdf

_my
description:
Most validations are skipped and the value returned unchanged when an empty string, null, or undefined is encountered (except "required").

Validations support a string format for dealing with large numbers.

types: {"is_empty": *, "required": function, "require_long": function, "string": function, "number": function, "whole_number": function, "unsigned": function, "is_digits": *, "to_number": *, "to_long": function, "to_string": function, "require_test": function, "require_match": *, "require_object_id": *, "require_range": function, "require_object_type": *, "get_instance": *, "require_relative_type": *, "get_relative_instance": *, "require_protocol_type": *, "get_protocol_instance": *, "get_protocol_type": *, "get_protocol_type_name": function, "require_implementation_type": *, "get_implementation_instance": *, "no_overflow53": function, "no_overflow64": function}

content:
{
    "name": "bitsharesjs",
    "version": "1.7.3",
    "description": "Pure JavaScript Bitshares library for node.js and browsers.",
    "browser": {
        "ws": false,
        "crypto": false
    },
    "scripts": {
        "test": "cross-env BABEL_ENV=test mocha --compilers js:babel-register --recursive",
        "test:chain": "cross-env BABEL_ENV=test mocha --compilers js:babel-register ./test/chain --recursive --watch",
        "test:trxbuilder": "cross-env BABEL_ENV=test mocha --compilers js:babel-register ./test/chain/TransactionBuilder.js --watch",
        "test:ecc": "cross-env BABEL_ENV=test mocha --compilers js:babel-register ./test/ecc --recursive",
        "test:serializer": "cross-env BABEL_ENV=test mocha --compilers js:babel-register ./test/serializer --recursive",
        "test:watch": "npm test -- --watch",
        "clean": "rimraf dist build es",
        "prebuild": "npm run clean",
        "build": "cross-env BABEL_ENV=cjs babel lib -d dist",
        "build-es": "cross-env BABEL_ENV=es babel lib -d es",
        "postbuild": "npm run browserify && npm run build-es",
        "build:watch": "babel lib -d dist --watch",
        "prebrowserify": "mkdirp build",
        "browserify": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production browserify --full-paths dist/browser.js --standalone bitshares_js -o build/bitsharesjs.js -d",
        "postbrowserify": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production uglifyjs --compress --mangle --sequences --drop_console --output build/bitsharesjs.min.js -- build/bitsharesjs.js",
        "precommit": "pretty-quick --staged && npm run test",
        "prepublish": "npm run build && npm run test",
        "doc": "esdoc -c esdoc.json",
        "example:transfer": "babel-node examples/transfer",
        "example:chainStore": "babel-node examples/chainStore",
        "example:privKey": "babel-node examples/privKey"
    },
    "repository": {
        "type": "git",
        "url": "git+https://github.com/bitshares/bitsharesjs.git"
    },
    "author": "Sigve Kvalsvik <bitsharesblocks@gmail.com> (https://github.com/svk31)",
    "contributors": [
        "James Calfee <james@jcalfee.info> (https://github.com/jcalfee/)",
        "Daniel Larimer <dan@cryptonomex.com> (https://github.com/bytemaster/)",
        "Valentine Zavgorodnev <valentine.zavgorodnev@gmail.com> (https://github.com/valzav/)"
    ],
    "license": "MIT",
    "bugs": {
        "url": "https://github.com/bitshares/bitsharesjs/issues"
    },
    "engines": {
        "node": ">= 6.0.0"
    },
    "main": "./dist/index.js",
    "jsnext:main": "./es/index.js",
    "dependencies": {
        "bigi": "1.4.2",
        "bitsharesjs-ws": "^1.5.2",
        "bs58": "4.0.1",
        "bytebuffer": "5.0.1",
        "create-hash": "1.2.0",
        "create-hmac": "1.1.7",
        "crypto-js": "3.1.9-1",
        "deep-equal": "1.0.1",
        "ecurve": "1.0.6",
        "event-emitter": "0.3.5",
        "immutable": "3.8.2",
        "safe-buffer": "^5.1.2",
        "secure-random": "1.1.1"
    },
    "devDependencies": {
        "assert": "^1.4.1",
        "babel-cli": "^6.26.0",
        "babel-eslint": "^8.2.3",
        "babel-plugin-add-module-exports": "^0.2.1",
        "babel-preset-env": "^1.7.0",
        "babel-preset-stage-1": "^6.24.1",
        "browserify": "^16.2.2",
        "cross-env": "^5.0.1",
        "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
        "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
        "eslint": "^4.19.1",
        "husky": "^0.14.3",
        "mkdirp": "^0.5.1",
        "mocha": "^5.2.0",
        "prettier": "^1.11.1",
        "pretty-quick": "^1.4.1",
        "rimraf": "^2.6.1",
        "uglify-js": "^3.3.10"
    }
}
name: package.json
